0.rationale:
Decision process: I'm currently at (2, 8) and my snake is facing LEFT. There are four apples in relatively close proximity, ranging from one to two moves away. The closest is (1, 9) directly up, then (3, 5) diagonally right/up, followed by (5, 0) right/down, and finally (7, 0) at a diagonal down before an up.

The left is blocked by myself, so moving there won't yield an apple. 

Analytics: 
- (1,9) - directly ahead and up, but blocked by myself at (2,9)
- (3,5) - diagonally right/up, but requires turning first to face it 
- (5,0) - to the right and down, then a diagonal up to reach apple 
- (7,0) - two diagonals down, then up to grab apple, longest path

Since the closest apple (1,9) is blocked by my own head, the best option is to turn right first and then head diagonally up to (3,5) for the next apple.

Next move: RIGHT then UP
